channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain blocked with dirt/dust, 19th May
item.description:
The drain is on a lane I think called Langdon Terrace between Ewlyn Road and Langdon Road. I am not sure if the lane is a public highway or not but the drain runs into the drains on Langdon Road and so the dirt/dust will run down to public highway if not cleaned out quickly before we get heavy rain. As you can see from picture it is very full and so would not want this to wash down into drainage system.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of large potholes around the church, 19th May
item.description:
There are a number of large potholes near to the church on the corner at Down Hatherley Lane. These potholes have been present for at least 6 months and need sorting ASAP. I keep having to swerve onto the opposite side of the road otherwise I will likely pop a tyre.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carisbrooke Road, Gloucester

item.title: Sunken trench across A435 south of Bishops Cleeve, 18th May
item.description:
The additional trench that was excavated across the A435 south of Bishops Cleeve has sunk again (2nd or 3rd time). There is a dip across the road. There are no warning signs. It is particularly hazardous for cyclists and motorcyclists. What3Words location ///hardly.ducks.chill
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken trench on A435 south of Bishops Cleeve, 18th May
item.description:
The trench that was excavated across the A435 south of Bishops Cleeve has sunk again (2nd or 3rd time). There is a significant dip across the road, meaning it can only be safely driven over at low speed. There are no warning signs. It is particularly hazardous for cyclists and motorcyclists. What3Words location ///soup.email.forces
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous broken glass, 18th May
item.description:
Next to the pedestrian crossing. I tried to pick some up but cut my hand. This could terribly injure animals or damage bike tyres. Please could it be removed asap. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
